methods.javadoc:
Generate vector with all coefficients zero.
@return the zero vector
methods.name: buildZeroVector
methods.comment: Generate vector with all coefficients zero.

methods.javadoc:
Generate an LSHVector from a feature set, individual features are integer hashes.
 The integers MUST already be sorted.
 The same integer can occur more than once in the array (term frequency (TF) > 1).
 The factory decides internally how to create weights based on term frequency and any
 knowledge of Inverse Document Frequency (IDF)
@param feature is the sorted array of integer features
@return the newly minted LSHVector
methods.name: buildVector
methods.comment:
Generate an LSHVector from a feature set, individual features are integer hashes.
 The integers MUST already be sorted.
 The same integer can occur more than once in the array (term frequency (TF)  1).
 The factory decides internally how to create weights based on term frequency and any
 knowledge of Inverse Document Frequency (IDF)

params.name: feature
params.comment: is the sorted array of integer features

methods.name: restoreVectorFromXml
methods.comment:
Generate an LSHVector based on XML tag seen by pull parser.
 Factory generates weights based on term frequency info in the XML tag and its internal IDF knowledge

methods.name: restoreVectorFromSql
methods.comment:
Generate an LSHVector based on string returned from SQL query
 Factory generates weights based on term frequency info in the string and its internal IDF knowledge

params.name: sql
params.comment: is the column data string returned by an SQL query

methods.name: set
methods.comment: Load the factory with weights and the feature map

params.name: wFactory
params.comment: is the weight table of IDF and TF weights

params.name: iLookup
params.comment: is the map from features int the weight table

params.name: settings
params.comment: is an integer id for this particular weighting scheme

methods.javadoc: @return true if this factory has weights and lookup loaded
methods.name: isLoaded

return.comment: true if this factory has weights and lookup loaded

methods.javadoc: @return the weighttable's significance scale for this factory
methods.name: getSignificanceScale

return.comment: the weighttable's significance scale for this factory

methods.javadoc: @return the weighttable's significance addend for this factory
methods.name: getSignificanceAddend

return.comment: the weighttable's significance addend for this factory

methods.javadoc: @return settings ID used to generate factory's current weights
methods.name: getSettings

return.comment: settings ID used to generate factory's current weights

methods.name: getSelfSignificance
methods.comment: Calculate a vector's significance as compared to itself, normalized for this factory's specific weight settings

methods.name: calculateSignificance
methods.comment:
Given comparison data generated by the LSHVector.compare() method,
 calculate the significance of any similarity between the two vectors,
 normalized for this factory's specific weight settings

params.name: data
params.comment: is the comparison object produced when comparing two LSHVectors

methods.name: readWeights
methods.comment: Read both the weights and the lookup hashes from an XML stream
